newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Sulzer Medica to get Swiss, U.S. listings.
newsitem.headline: Sulzer Medica to get Swiss, U.S. listings.

text.p: Sulzer AG said it expected shares of Sulzer Medica to be listed in Switzerland and the United States when it floats around a quarter of the equity in its medical technology division.
In a prepared text released ahead of a news conference, chief executive Fritz Fahrni said some decisions about the Medica flotation had already been made.
"Morgan Stanley and SBC Warburg are the lead banks. Listings in Switzerland as well as the United States are planned," he said. Andre Buchel will remain chief executive.

"Sulzer Medica's board of directors will be small and comprise around six members. A third of them will come from outside Sulzer from the international medical device sector," he said, adding Medica's legal domicile will be in Switzerland.
Sulzer said in January it would float Sulzer Medica, one of its five operating groups, to raise money for acquisitions. The offering is expected to raise 700-750 million Swiss francs.
Fahrni declined to make any forecasts for the division pending the flotation.
